newsitem.title: USA: Wall Street shares seen opening modestly higher.
newsitem.headline: Wall Street shares seen opening modestly higher.

text.p: Wall Street is expected to open a little higher on Friday but trading volume will be light going into a three-day holiday weekend, dealers said.
In the absence of fresh economic data, bonds would once again lead the way, they said.

The Dow Jones Industrial average closed down 32.56 points to 7,258.13 on Thursday, as investors had second thoughts about a Federal Reserve decision to leave interest rates unchanged and bonds weakened further.
The long bond, which hit a key seven percent level on Thursday, was up 6/32 at a 6.98 percent yield on Friday.
